headline: Can Coca-Cola's Zero Sugar Portfolio Drive Its Volume Growth?
summary: KO's expanding Zero Sugar lineup is fueling share gains and volume momentum as health-conscious demand reshapes its growth playbook.

headline: Can Functional Snacks and Drinks Power PepsiCo's Next Leg Up?
summary: PEP is ramping up functional beverages and snacks, targeting health-driven demand to fuel growth beyond sodas and salty snacks.

headline: Crown Castle and AT&T Tumble While Coca-Cola Rises as Dividened Stocks Take a Breather
summary: It’s been a fantastic 2026 for most dividend stocks so far this year, but most dividend-payers took a break last week. The Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF was flat while the Consumer Staples SPDR fell 1.8%. With the stock market opening in about 90 minutes for the week, let’s take a look back at which ... Crown Castle and AT&T Tumble While Coca-Cola Rises as Dividened Stocks Take a Breather

headline: What Coca-Cola (KO)'s 64th Straight Dividend Hike and IR Leadership Shift Means For Shareholders
summary: The Coca-Cola Company recently approved its 64th consecutive annual dividend increase, lifting the quarterly payout from US$0.51 to US$0.53 per share and confirming a first-quarter dividend of US$2.12 per share annualized, while also electing long-time finance executive Todd Beiger as vice president and head of investor relations effective March 31, 2026. This combination of a higher cash return and an experienced investor-relations leader highlights how Coca-Cola is emphasizing continuity...

headline: 1 Unpopular Stock That Deserves Some Love and 2 Facing Headwinds
summary: Wall Street’s bearish price targets for the stocks in this article signal serious concerns. Such forecasts are uncommon in an industry where maintaining cordial corporate relationships often trumps delivering the hard truth.

headline: BofA Lifts Coca-Cola (KO) Target as Outlook and Execution Remain Strong
summary: The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE:KO) is included among the 14 Best Warren Buffett Dividend Stocks to Buy. On February 18, BofA analyst Peter Galbo raised his price recommendation on The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE:KO) to $88 from $85. The analyst reiterated a Buy rating on the stock. He said the company “sounded positive” and delivered “another bottler-friendly […]
